description: Foreign key to compound_records. Record representing the drug or other compound for which metabolism is being studied (may not be the same as the substrate being measured)
Foreign key to compound_records. Record representing the compound that is the subject of metabolism
Foreign key to compound_records. Record representing the compound that is the result of metabolism
Identifier for the metabolic scheme/pathway (may be multiple pathways from one source document)
Link to original source indicating where the pathway information was found (e.g., Figure 1, page 23)
Name of the enzyme responsible for the metabolic conversion
Foreign key to target_dictionary. TID for the enzyme responsible for the metabolic conversion
Organism in which this metabolic reaction occurs
NCBI Tax ID for the organism in which this metabolic reaction occurs
Additional information regarding the metabolism (e.g., organ system, conditions under which observed, activity of metabolites)

sample_rows.met_conversion: Methylation of the hydroxyl in the meta position
sample_rows.met_comment: Organ: Liver|Comment: Subsequent glucuronidation and sulfation leads to the production of the predominant metabolites found in the urine and faeces.

sample_rows.met_conversion: Ether link cleavage removing the phenol
sample_rows.met_comment: Organ: Liver|Comment: Subsequent glucuronidation leads to the production of the predominant metabolites found in the urine and faeces.
Organ: Liver|Comment: Part of the main route of metabolism.

sample_rows.met_conversion: Methylation of the hydroxyl in the para position
sample_rows.met_comment: Organ: Liver|Comment: Subsequent glucuronidation leads to the production of the predominant metabolites found in the urine and faeces.
Organ: Liver and Intestines|Comment: Minor inactive metabolite.
